body_html:
May very well be a Windows thing...
With tf.logging.set_verbosity set to INFO or DEBUG, tensorflow does not print additional output for just sess = tf.Session().

It seems to have some effect as it seems to differenciate between graphic card 1 and graphic cards [0, 2, 3]. If I do not set CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES at all, it allocates memory on all four cards.
body_text:
May very well be a Windows thing...
With tf.logging.set_verbosity set to INFO or DEBUG, tensorflow does not print additional output for just sess = tf.Session().
It seems to have some effect as it seems to differenciate between graphic card 1 and graphic cards [0, 2, 3]. If I do not set CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES at all, it allocates memory on all four cards.
body:
May very well be a Windows thing... 
With `tf.logging.set_verbosity` set to INFO or DEBUG, tensorflow does not print additional output for just `sess = tf.Session()`.

It seems to have some effect as it seems to differenciate between graphic card 1 and graphic cards [0, 2, 3]. If I do not set CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES at all, it allocates memory on all four cards.
